column4: hi guys I burned the contents of /var/cache/apt/archives/ to dvd and want to know if i take this to my friends machine how i would go about installing them all at once
dpkg -i
so you've got a bunch of .deb's  which you install with 'sudo dpkg -i pkgname'
sudo dpkg -i *     is kind of asking for trouble, maybe 'for x in * ; do sudo dpkg -i $x ; done'
'for x in * ; do sudo dpkg -i $x ; done'
yes - use frostwire
frostwire kills you puter? that's not cool
I could never find anything worthwhile on amule, frostwire's much more accessible
very odd if a java app is crashing your box ...
sudo dpkg --purge limewire
man dpkg, man apt-get, man apt-cache
sudo dpkg --purge frostwire          not sure what limewire's installed as
if it's packaged properly, yes
I've never installed it, but if it's a deb, dpkg --purge PKGNAME will remove it
d/l & install/configure smartmontools
dpkg --get-selections > out.txt
load up grub from a live cd
d/l RIP
ext3 had journalling, so will usually not need to fsck, & is probably best for all but high performance/big iron applications
dont wanna know about grub man
back up /etc & the output of 'dpkg --get-selections'   & you should be able to recreate  your box without too much difficulty
Im actually using debian and winxp on this comp and i only have a ubuntu edgy cd should this still work
yep
